009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
021import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver;
022
023/**
024 * Algebraic ellipse fit based on Taubin's method [1].
025 * Version 1 uses the full scatter and constraint matrix (6x6).
026 * The constraint matrix (C) is not positive definite.
027 * The solution is found by a generalized symmetric eigenproblem.
028 * Performs data centering or alternatively accepts a specific reference point.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2021/11/09
032 */
033public class EllipseFitTaubin1 implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
034        
035        private final double[] p;       // p = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
036        
037        public EllipseFitTaubin1(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
038                if (points.length < 5) {
039                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 5 points must be supplied for ellipse fitting");
040                }
041                this.p = fit(points, xref);
042                
043        }
044        
045        public EllipseFitTaubin1(Pnt2d[] points) {
046                this(points, PntUtils.centroid(points));
047        }
048
049        @Override
050        public double[] getParameters() {
051                return this.p;
052        }
053        
054        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
055        
056        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
057                final int n = points.length;
058                
059                // reference point
060                final double xr = xref.getX();
061                final double yr = xref.getY();
062
063                // design matrix (same as Fitzgibbon):
064                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 6);
065                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
066                        final double x = points[i].getX() - xr; // center data set
067                        final double y = points[i].getY() - yr;
068                        double[] fi = {sqr(x), x*y, sqr(y), x, y, 1};
069                        X.setRow(i, fi);
070                }
071                
072                // scatter matrix S (normalized by 1/n)
073                RealMatrix S = X.transpose().multiply(X).scalarMultiply(1.0/n);
074//              IJ.log("M = \n" + imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.toString(S.getData()));
075                        
076                double a = S.getEntry(0, 5);
077                double b = S.getEntry(2, 5);
078                double c = S.getEntry(1, 5);    //2*s[1][5];
079                double d = S.getEntry(3, 5);
080                double e = S.getEntry(4, 5);
081//              IJ.log("d = " + d);
082//              IJ.log("e = " + e);
083                
084                RealMatrix C = Matrix.makeRealMatrix(6, 6, 
085                                4*a, 2*c, 0,   2*d, 0,   0 , 
086                                2*c, a+b, 2*c, e,   d,   0 , 
087                                0,   2*c, 4*b, 0,   2*e, 0 , 
088                                2*d, e,   0,   1,   0,   0 ,
089                                0,   d,   2*e, 0,   1,   0 , 
090                                0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0 );
091                
092//              IJ.log("S is positive definite: " + isPositiveDefinite(S));
093//              IJ.log("C is positive definite: " + isPositiveDefinite(C));
094                
095                // solve C*p = lambda*S*p
096                GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver eigen = 
097                                new GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver(C, S, 1e-15, 1e-15);        // S, C reversed, since C is not positive definite
098                
099                double[] evals = eigen.getRealEigenvalues();
100//              IJ.log("evals = " + Arrays.toString(evals));
101                
102                int k = Matrix.idxMax(evals);   // index of largest eigenvalue
103                double[] p0 = eigen.getEigenVector(k).toArray();
104                
105                RealMatrix U = getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(xr, yr);
106                double[] p = U.operate(p0);
107                
108                return Matrix.normalize(p);
109        }
110        
111        private static double TOLERANCE = 1e-16;
112        
113        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
114        private boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {      
115                try {
116                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, TOLERANCE, TOLERANCE);
117                        return true;
118                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
119                
120                return false;
121        }
122
123
124}
